workflow.name: Chat with PDF docs using AI (quoting sources)
workflow.description:
This workflow allows you to ask questions about a PDF document. The answers are provided by an AI model of your choice, and the answer includes a citation pointing to the information it used.

You can use n8n‚Äôs built-in chat interface to ask the questions, or you could customise this workflow to use another one (e.g. Slack, Teams, etc.)

### Example

The workflow is set up with the Bitcoin whitepaper. So you could ask things like:

*Question: ‚ÄúWhich email provider does the creator of Bitcoin use?‚Äú*
*Answer: ‚ÄúGMX [Bitcoin whitepaper.pdf, lines 1-35]‚Äù*

### Requirements

1. A Pinecone account (they have a free tier at the time of writing that is easily enough for this workflow)
2. Access to a large language model (e.g. an OpenAI account)

### Customizing this workflow

The workflow only reads in one document, but you could customise it to read in all the documents in a folder (or more).

The workflow is set up to use GPT 3.5, but you could swap that out for any other model (including self-hosted ones).

parameters.content:
## 1. Setup: Fetch file from Google Drive, split it into chunks and insert into a vector database
Note that running this part multiple times will insert multiple copies into your DB

# Try me out
1. In Pinecone, create an index with 1536 dimensions and select it in the two vector store nodes
2. Populate Pinecone by clicking the 'test workflow' button below
3. Click the 'chat' button below and enter the following:

_Which email provider does the creator of Bitcoin use?_
## 2. Chat with file, getting citations in reponse
Will fetch the Bitcoin whitepaper, but you can change this

nodes.name: Set file URL in Google Drive
Set max chunks to send to model
Answer the query based on chunks

options.systemPromptTemplate: =Use the following pieces of context to answer the question at the end. If you don't know the answer, just say that you don't know, don't try to make up an answer. Important: In your response, also include the the indexes of the chunks you used to generate the answer.

assignments.name: citations
assignments.value: ={{ $json.citations.map(i => '[' + $('Get top chunks matching query').all()[$json.citations].json.document.metadata.file_name + ', lines ' + $('Get top chunks matching query').all()[$json.citations].json.document.metadata['loc.lines.from'] + '-' + $('Get top chunks matching query').all()[$json.citations].json.document.metadata['loc.lines.to'] + ']') }}

main.node: Answer the query based on chunks

ai_languageModel.node: Answer the query based on chunks

main.node: Set max chunks to send to model
Set file URL in Google Drive
